roleset.name: increase, rise
roleset.note: GAIN-V NOTES: Let's use EXT for numericals only, otherwise Arg2-MNR: (from gain.01-v)
GAIN-N NOTES: Based on verb entry gain.01; corresponds to VN class calibratable_cos-45.6-1. (from gain.01-n)

example.name: with EXT and end point
example.text: The Nasdaq 100 index gained 1.39 to 446.62 on heavy volume.

example.name: all args!
example.text: Revenue gained 13% to $77 million from $68.5 million.

example.name: arg2 as manner
example.text: Bond prices and the dollar both gained modestly.
example.arg: Bond prices and the dollar both

example.name: Arg 1 only
example.text: Stocks are holding on to their gains in late trading, with all three major indexes up more than 1% in late trading.

example.name: Args 3 & 4
example.text: This has been accomplished by reducing the taxable amount of the gain from 75% to 37-1/2%.

example.name: With attribute
example.text: ...stocks trading at multiyear lows such as WorldCom (WCOM), which has retraced its gains in price all the way back to February 1998.

roleset.name: acquire
roleset.note: GAIN-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry gain.02; corresponds to VN class get-13.5.1-1. (from gain.02-n)

example.name: just transitive
example.text: The company could gain millions of dollars if the deal goes through.

example.name: another transitive
example.text: Both contracts have gained a following since the 1987 global market crash.

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: ...the unsuccessful effort *trace* to gain bank loans for the labor management group.

example.name: with source
example.text: Both companies would gain technological knowledge through the sale of GenProbe

example.name: Args 0 & 1
example.text: As shown 'weak ties' provide photographic inspiration for Flickr's users and prove valuable in their gaining of recognition and exposure.

example.name: With source
example.text: Also, the mangaka admitted to his gaining of illegal profits from the work, and paid back a portion of his sales.
